definition: to feel indignant/to feel aggrieved
indignant/anger/resentment
indignant/anger/resentment
(negative prefix)/not/no
flat/level/equal/to tie (make the same score)/to draw (score)/calm/peaceful/see also 平聲|平声[ping2 sheng1]
surname Ping

sentences.english: Which, of course—as Patty told the other mothers—struck Joey as an outrage.
sentences.chinese: 帕蒂告訴其他媽媽，喬伊當然對此憤憤不平。

sentences.english: Over there, the aggrieved, jun has been seeking private detective, investigating Carrie.
sentences.chinese: 那邊廂，憤憤不平的日君已訪尋私家偵探，調查嘉莉。

sentences.english: My sister and I listen to and gnash, resentfully to walk home.
sentences.chinese: 我和姐姐聽了，氣得咬牙切齒，憤憤不平地走回家去。

sentences.english: Miners have complained bitterly that the government did not fulfill their promises.
sentences.chinese: 礦工們憤憤不平地抱怨說政府沒有履行諾言。

definition: to hate/hatred/to resent/embittered
hanging one's head dispiritedly (idiom); dejected/crestfallen
to fly into a rage out of humiliation/to be ashamed into anger (idiom)
to burst into tears/to sob loudly/to bawl
dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
to lose one's head out of fear (idiom)
gongs and drums overture to a Chinese opera/to create a disturbance
to keep silent
frigid irony and scorching satire (idiom); to mock and ridicule
to force someone to do something
to contradict (elders or superiors)
to submit to humiliation (idiom); to suffer in silence/to swallow one's anger/to grin and bear it
to bare fangs and brandish claws (idiom); to make threatening gestures
to give vent to anger
to damn/to curse/to revile
head and face filthy with grime (idiom)/covered in dirt/dejected and depressed
